requirement_tested: Frontend application that fetches all data from backend APIs with no hardcoded or mock data
user_persona: A poetry enthusiast visiting the homepage for the first time.
user_goal: To see a list of poetry posts loaded dynamically from the backend.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting Homepage
narrative_steps.description: Maya opens the poetry blog website and expects to see real poetry content fetched from the server.
narrative_steps.action: Load the homepage URL in browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The page displays a grid of poetry cards populated with live data from the backend API.

narrative_steps.title: Scrolling Down
narrative_steps.description: As Maya scrolls toward the bottom, she anticipates seeing more poetry load automatically.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll down near the bottom of the page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Additional poetry entries are fetched and appended seamlessly without requiring a page refresh.

requirement_tested: Backend API server that connects to PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
user_persona: A developer deploying the backend service.
user_goal: To confirm the backend successfully connects to the PostgreSQL database.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Server
narrative_steps.description: Jamie sets up the environment variables and starts the backend server.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` in the backend directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server logs indicate successful connection to PostgreSQL using DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, etc.

requirement_tested: Database schema supporting poetry posts, user accounts, and comments
user_persona: A database administrator reviewing the setup.
user_goal: To verify the correct schema is implemented in the PostgreSQL database.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Tables
narrative_steps.description: Alex inspects the database to ensure all necessary tables exist.
narrative_steps.action: Query the database for tables: users, poetry, and comments.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All three tables exist with appropriate columns and foreign key relationships defined.

requirement_tested: Poetry browsing functionality with categorized views for different types of poetry
user_persona: A reader interested in exploring Haikus specifically.
user_goal: To browse only Haiku poems using category filters.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating Categories
narrative_steps.description: Riley notices the horizontal category bar and wants to filter by 'Haiku'.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Haiku' category link.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Page updates dynamically to show only poetry entries tagged with the 'Haiku' category.

requirement_tested: Search functionality allowing users to find specific poetry by keywords or filters
user_goal: To search for poetry containing the word 'autumn' in its content.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Search Query
narrative_steps.description: Jordan types 'autumn' into the search bar and selects 'Content' as the filter.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'autumn' into the search input. Select 'Content' from dropdown. Press Enter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Results update to show only poems whose content contains the word 'autumn'.

requirement_tested: User authentication system for posting poetry and commenting
user_persona: A new poet wanting to join the community.
user_goal: To register an account and log in to start participating.

narrative_steps.title: Signing Up
narrative_steps.description: Taylor clicks 'Sign Up', fills out the registration form, and submits it.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in email, username, password, and confirm password. Click 'Sign Up'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Account is created successfully and Taylor receives confirmation message.

narrative_steps.title: Logging In
narrative_steps.description: After signing up, Taylor logs in with the new credentials.
narrative_steps.action: Enter username and password. Click 'Log In'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Successfully logged in, redirected to homepage with session maintained via JWT.

requirement_tested: Poetry submission form with fields for title, content, category, and author
user_persona: An authenticated user ready to share their original poem.
user_goal: To publish a new poem titled 'Sunset Dreams'.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Submission Form
narrative_steps.description: Casey navigates to the 'Post Poetry' section and sees the submission form.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to poetry submission page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Form appears with fields for Title, Category, and Content.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting New Poem
narrative_steps.description: Casey fills in the details and submits the poem.
narrative_steps.action: Enter 'Sunset Dreams' as title, choose 'Lyric' as category, write some lines in content. Click Submit.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: New poem is saved to database and user is redirected to the poem's detail page.

requirement_tested: Commenting system allowing users to comment on poetry posts
user_persona: A reader who enjoyed a poem and wants to leave feedback.
user_goal: To post a thoughtful comment on a specific poem.

narrative_steps.title: Reading a Poem
narrative_steps.description: Morgan reads a beautiful poem and scrolls down to the comments section.
narrative_steps.action: Open a poetry detail page and scroll to comments area.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Existing comments are displayed, along with a text area to enter a new comment.

narrative_steps.title: Posting Comment
narrative_steps.description: Morgan writes a comment and submits it immediately.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'This poem gave me chills!' in the textarea. Click 'Post Comment'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Comment appears instantly under the poem without needing to reload the entire page.

requirement_tested: Responsive layout design with light goldenrod color scheme
user_persona: A mobile user accessing the site on a phone.
user_goal: To navigate the site comfortably on a small screen.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Site on Mobile
narrative_steps.description: Drew visits the poetry blog on their smartphone and checks the visual appeal.
narrative_steps.action: Resize viewport to mobile size or open on mobile device.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Layout adjusts responsively, maintaining readability and usability with light goldenrod background.

requirement_tested: Button and card components styled with olive drab color
user_persona: A UI reviewer checking consistency of component styles.
user_goal: To verify buttons and cards use the correct olive drab styling.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Buttons
narrative_steps.description: Quinn examines various buttons across the site to check uniformity.
narrative_steps.action: Locate and inspect multiple buttons such as 'Login', 'Submit', and 'Search'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All buttons have olive drab background (#6B8E23) and white text, with slight hover effect.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Cards
narrative_steps.description: Quinn also reviews how poetry cards look visually.
narrative_steps.action: Look at several poetry cards in the feed.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Cards have thin olive drab borders and match the defined style guide.

requirement_tested: Package.json configuration with 'install:all' script for frontend and backend dependency installation
user_persona: A contributor cloning the project for local development.
user_goal: To install dependencies for both frontend and backend efficiently.

narrative_steps.title: Running Install Script
narrative_steps.description: Sam clones the repo and runs the unified install command.
narrative_steps.action: Execute `npm run install:all` from root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dependencies for both frontend and backend are installed concurrently without errors.

requirement_tested: Package.json configuration with 'dev' script to concurrently start frontend and backend services
user_persona: A developer beginning daily work on the project.
user_goal: To launch both frontend and backend servers simultaneously.

narrative_steps.title: Launching Dev Environment
narrative_steps.description: Riley prepares to develop locally by starting both services together.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` from the root folder.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend servers start concurrently, accessible at their respective ports.

requirement_tested: RESTful API endpoints for poetry CRUD operations
user_persona: A tester validating API behavior for poetry management.
user_goal: To perform basic CRUD operations on poetry resources via API calls.

narrative_steps.title: Creating a Poem
narrative_steps.description: Tester sends a POST request to create a new poem entry.
narrative_steps.action: Send POST request to `/api/poetry` with valid payload.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Returns 201 Created with the newly created poem object.

narrative_steps.title: Retrieving a Poem
narrative_steps.description: Tester retrieves the same poem using its ID.
narrative_steps.action: Send GET request to `/api/poetry/{id}`.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Returns 200 OK with the full poem details.

requirement_tested: API endpoints for user authentication and session management
user_persona: An API consumer integrating authentication features.
user_goal: To authenticate a user and obtain a session token.

narrative_steps.title: Authenticating User
narrative_steps.description: Developer makes a login request with valid credentials.
narrative_steps.action: Send POST request to `/api/auth/login` with username and password.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Receives 200 OK with a JWT token included in response body or headers.

requirement_tested: Database migration scripts for setting up tables and relationships
user_persona: A deployment engineer initializing the database schema.
user_goal: To set up the database schema using migration files.

narrative_steps.title: Running Migrations
narrative_steps.description: DevOps engineer executes migration scripts to build database structure.
narrative_steps.action: Run `knex migrate:latest` in the backend directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tables for users, poetry, and comments are created with proper constraints and relationships.
